/%T THE MID-YEAR milestone in 1958 we
can report an enthusiastic optimism among
staff members of the National Education
Program, a solid and growing belief that
America will turn back Socialism and with¬
stand the machinations of world Commu¬
nism. During 1957 and especially in the
first six months of 1958 we have watched,
indeed we have been participating in a
significant expansion of an informed citizen
force determined to keep our basic economic
and political principles intact. Yes, we are
gaining strength—school teachers, educa¬
tional administrators, the wage-earning and
salaried men and women of America are
now paying attention to the American story;
more and more of them are beginning to
pass the facts along to their fellows. With
the inauguration of a second annual Free¬
dom Forum at Oklahoma City in co¬
sponsorship with educational, business and
industrial leaders; with our new series of
filmstrips and movies dramatically showing '
how much more human welfare our private
enterprise economU s.y»l&m -
than the socialistic Welfare States of Europe,
and with the addition to our staff of Howard
W. Bennett, former General Electric eco¬
nomics education specialist, we have
strengthened and intensified all phases of
our nationwide work. This report to patrons
and friends of the Program reflects some of
the highlights of our progress.
—George S. Benson
